conversation: The patient has been experiencing severe right knee pain for a few weeks, worsening with walking or climbing stairs. There is morning stiffness and mild swelling after prolonged walking. No history of injury, but the patient's father had arthritis. Upon examination, the patient feels sharp pain on the inner side of the knee. The doctor suspects mild osteoarthritis or a ligament strain and recommends an X-ray for confirmation. Treatment includes avoiding excessive walking, applying ice packs twice daily, and taking **Tab. Aceclofenac 100mg + Paracetamol 325mg (twice daily after meals for 5 days)**. Light knee exercises are advised while avoiding squatting. A follow-up is required after the X-ray.
